column2: COLORADO DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column10: To decrease the state average speed statistic.

column2: 2. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column6: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column8: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column10: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.

column2: 3. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column10: Only if the light is green.

column2: 4. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: swing to the right side of your lane.
column6: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.

column2: 5. This sign indicates that:
column4: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column6: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column8: there is a school zone after the curve.
column10: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.

column2: 6. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column8: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 7. This road sign:
column4: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 8. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 9. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column10: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column2: 10. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column10: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

14. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
15. When driving on major highways you should:
column4: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 16. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
18. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 19. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?

21. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.

23. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column6: look toward the right side of the road.
column8: look toward the left side of the road.
column10: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.

column2: 24. BAC is expressed in:
column8: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column8: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
